mdRecord.dcterms:title: Violetta electrotherapy machine
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Bleadon-Dun Co. [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Electrotherapy machine is in a case with metal clasps and a leather handle. The case contains one Tesla coil transformer with electric cord, 6 glass electrodes with metal tips (one electrode includes a sticker that says, John Wanamaker 1.00 Philadelphia). The transformer has a metal plate which reads, Violetta Man'f'd. by Bleadon-Dun Co. Chicago, Ill. Patent Pending, 110 volts A.C. or D.C. The inside of the box lid has a guarantee from the Bleadon-Dun Co. of Chicago, IL. The item belonged to Mary Gibson's father, Joseph L. Eckenrode. [original]
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medical instruments or apparatus--Electrotherapeutics--Gibson, Mary Eckenrode
